intro: Newcastelia cephalantha var. queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland rockheath, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
